item.title: Suspend pod in Kubernetes
item.description:
The Deployment controller implements a very important function in Kubernetes clusters: the horizontal scaling and shrinking of Pods. This capability is essential for platforms in the traditional cloud era.

Encountered a business scenario where data in the database needs to be modified and Pod nodes need to be restarted after adjustment. However, while the Pod is running, table fields are constantly being modified. It’s necessary to temporarily pause the application’s updates to the table, adjust the data, and then restore the Pod.

Are there other ways to achieve a similar effect as pausing, besides forcefully deleting Deployments?

kubectl scale --replicas=0 deployment/<your-deployment>

Before seeing the answer, many people probably wouldn’t have thought of it. After seeing the answer, they might smile and realize their thinking hasn’t moved on – still stuck in an era focused on directly manipulating processes, wanting to operate business processes directly.
